action.content:
You are a language wizard who likes to guess words by using the given rules.

Welcome to Wordle! You have six attempts to guess the target word, a valid English word of five lowercase letters (a-z). Please use the tags "explanation:" and "guess:" to provide a concise explanation for each guess.

For instance, if your guess is "apple", your response should be
explanation: this is a common five-letter English word, and I am starting my guess with this word.
guess: apple

After each guess, your answer will be validated, and you will receive feedback indicating which letters are correct (green), which letters are correct but in the wrong position (yellow), and which letters are incorrect (red). This feedback can be useful in determining which letters to include or exclude in your next guess.

For example, the feedback for "apple" might be:
guess_feedback: a<yellow> p<yellow> p<green> l<yellow> e<red>

The explanation should contain details about how the guess_feedback is used to arrive at a new guess.

Do not generate any other text.

Let's begin with your first guess.

explanation: This is a common five-letter English word, and I am starting my guess with this word.
guess: apple

attempts = 1
target_word = month
guess = apple
guess_feedback = a<red> p<red> p<red> l<red> e<red>

guess_feedback: a<red> p<red> p<red> l<red> e<red>

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: All letters in "apple" are incorrect, so I will try a completely different set of letters. "crane" is a good candidate as it contains distinct letters and is a valid English word.
guess: crane

attempts = 2
target_word = month
guess = crane
guess_feedback = c<red> r<red> a<red> n<yellow> e<red>

guess_feedback: c<red> r<red> a<red> n<yellow> e<red>

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: The letter "n" is correct but in the wrong position. I will exclude "c", "r", "a", and "e" from the next guess and try placing "n" in a different position. "lions" is a good choice as it moves "n" to a new spot and introduces unique letters.
guess: lions

attempts = 3
target_word = month
guess = lions
guess_feedback = l<red> i<red> o<yellow> n<yellow> s<red>

guess_feedback: l<red> i<red> o<yellow> n<yellow> s<red>

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: The letters "o" and "n" are correct but in the wrong positions. I will exclude "l", "i", and "s" from the next guess and try placing "o" and "n" in different positions. "mourn" is a valid word that moves "o" and "n" while introducing new letters.
guess: mourn

attempts = 4
target_word = month
guess = mourn
guess_feedback = m<green> o<green> u<red> r<red> n<yellow>

guess_feedback: m<green> o<green> u<red> r<red> n<yellow>

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: The letters "m" and "o" are correct and in the right positions, while "n" is correct but still in the wrong position. I will exclude "u" and "r" from the next guess and try placing "n" in a new position. "month" is a valid word that keeps "m" and "o" fixed and moves "n".
guess: month

attempts = 5
target_word = month
guess = month
guess_feedback = m<green> o<green> n<green> t<green> h<green>

guess_explanation: This is a common five-letter English word, and I am starting my guess with this word.
All letters in "apple" are incorrect, so I will try a completely different set of letters. "crane" is a good candidate as it contains distinct letters and is a valid English word.

The letter "n" is correct but in the wrong position. I will exclude "c", "r", "a", and "e" from the next guess and try placing "n" in a different position. "lions" is a good choice as it moves "n" to a new spot and introduces unique letters.

The letters "o" and "n" are correct but in the wrong positions. I will exclude "l", "i", and "s" from the next guess and try placing "o" and "n" in different positions. "mourn" is a valid word that moves "o" and "n" while introducing new letters.

The letters "m" and "o" are correct and in the right positions, while "n" is correct but still in the wrong position. I will exclude "u" and "r" from the next guess and try placing "n" in a new position. "month" is a valid word that keeps "m" and "o" fixed and moves "n".
